description:
Collabora is delighted to announce a growing collaboration with MediaTek which will enable Collabora to introduce, improve, and maintain MediaTek's IoT Edge AI Genio platforms upstream, with the goal of fully supporting the official Evaluation Kit (EVK) in Debian as well as other Linux distributions.

The post Full Upstream Support Coming for MediaTek’s IoT Edge AI Genio platforms appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Full Upstream Support Coming for MediaTek’s IoT Edge AI Genio platforms

description:
In this article, I’ll provide a detailed understanding of what hashdeep is, how it works, and how you can use it effectively in Linux environments.

The post Hashdeep: A Powerful Tool for File Verification in Linux appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Hashdeep: A Powerful Tool for File Verification in Linux

description:
Nginx or NGINX is a widely used web server with many features, including load balancing, reverse proxying, content caching, mail proxying, and more. In this tutorial, you will learn to configure Nginx as a reverse proxy on Ubuntu 24.04.

The post How To Configure Nginx as a Reverse Proxy on Ubuntu 24.04 appeared first on Linux Today.
title: How To Configure Nginx as a Reverse Proxy on Ubuntu 24.04

description:
Learn how to install and use Docker Rollout to quickly update the Docker Compose services with zero downtime by automating every task.

The post Docker Rollout: Zero Downtime Deployment for Docker Compose appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Docker Rollout: Zero Downtime Deployment for Docker Compose

description:
WUD just released version 7.1, bringing a fresh set of features to streamline container management and alerts that will definitely excite Docker enthusiasts. But wait—haven’t you heard of it? Well, here’s the short version.

The post WUD 7.1 Brings Fresh Notification Features to Docker Monitoring appeared first on Linux Today.
title: WUD 7.1 Brings Fresh Notification Features to Docker Monitoring

description:
This article discusses Am I Isolated, an open-source container security benchmark that probes users’ runtime environments and tests for container isolation.

The post Am I Isolated: Open-source container security benchmark appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Am I Isolated: Open-source container security benchmark

description:
DXVK 2.5 optimizes memory with periodic defragmentation, enabling efficient resource use for better game performance without increasing VRAM costs.

The post DXVK 2.5 Unveils Major Memory Management Overhaul for Smoother Gaming appeared first on Linux Today.
title: DXVK 2.5 Unveils Major Memory Management Overhaul for Smoother Gaming

description:
This article will walk you through how to use FFmpeg on Linux to count video frames.

The post How to Count Total Frames in a Video on Linux Using FFmpeg appeared first on Linux Today.
title: How to Count Total Frames in a Video on Linux Using FFmpeg

description:
In this guide, we'll show you how to install Vuls Vulnerability Scanner on Ubuntu 24.04 server. You'll be installing Vuls, generating CVE databases, and scanning Ubuntu/Debian via local and remote scans

The post How to Install and Use Vuls Vulnerability Scanner on Ubuntu 24.04 appeared first on Linux Today.
title: How to Install and Use Vuls Vulnerability Scanner on Ubuntu 24.04
